newsitem.title: INDIA: Higher private power consumption hits India's SEBs.
newsitem.headline: Higher private power consumption hits India's SEBs.

text.p: India's power consumption pattern which has seen more domestic and agricultural users has worsened the poor performance of state electricity boards (SEBs), Dun & Phelps Credit Rating India Private Limited said on Friday.

"The domestic and agriculture sector which constituted only 11 percent and six percent of the total power consumption in 1960-61, increased their share considerably to 18.2 percent and 29.6 percent in 1993/94 respectively," it said.
The credit rating agency said during the same period the share of the industrial sector -- the largest electricity consumer -- fell sharply to 40 percent from 69 percent.
"This shift in consumption pattern towards domestic and agriculture sector -- which are heavily subsidised -- further deteriorated the financial health of the SEBs," it said.
Dun & Phelps said the commercial losses of all SEBs totalled 71.3 billion rupees ($2.04 billion) in calendar 1996.
Most of them incur heavy losses on account of subsidised tariffs given to agriculture and domestic sectors, the agency said.
